intro: Fagara pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's fagara, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically dark blue or black when mature. Fagara pringlei is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and mountainous areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native ecosystems.
